name: nonequivalence
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the fact of having a different amount, value, purpose, quality, etc.: The paper examines the nonequivalence in meanings of these words in a number of different contexts. The non-equivalence between the two concepts has been well established.
More examplesFewer examplesThe research paper outlines a theoretical approach to conceptual nonequivalence between languages.A translator needs to be aware of cases of non-equivalence between two apparently equivalent terms.Would such an explicit focus on conceptual nonequivalence when teaching a foreign language lead to a faster and richer acquisition of conceptual representations?
